result.execSummary:
The defendant Roxann S. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct Ordinance Violation [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roxann S. Jones

records.addlTxt:
Count 1:  AMENDED to a Portage County Ordinance 
Non-Probation
Stipulation and Order filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 04/26/22 sp)
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:49 PM Defendant Roxann S. Jones in court with Attorney (Atty) Jerod Barkley. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Atty Barkley wishes to make a request on bond and states his request on the record.
BY THE COURT:
Court is not willing to change the bond at this point.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 007218,
Payable Number: 59010,
Receipt Number: 22R 000868,
Amount: $20.00

ADDRESS INFO for Roxann S. Jones
Current: 441 Washington Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 01-28-2022)
Prior: 422 Sherman Ave 61, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Initial Appearance set for January 31, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *R.J.S.  or his residence
Do not possess any firearms 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
May go to the premises one time, accompanied by law enforcement, to retrieve personal belongings.

1:03 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic with a dangerous weapon and 2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 
Court adopts the $1,000 signature bond as requested by the State with conditions as stated on the record. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for:   January 31, 2022  @ 1:45 p.m.  in Branch 1
